summary: This is an internal email chain from April 2021 regarding logistical arrangements for Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team to review evidence at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse in preparation for her trial. It details the security and monitoring protocols involving the FBI, US Marshals, and prosecutors.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case, to be produced by US Marshals to the 500 Pearl Street courthouse for evidence review with her defense team.

events.title: Start of Maxwell's Evidence Review
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team begin reviewing evidence at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse, with FBI agents and AUSAs present for security and monitoring.

locations: 500 Pearl Street courthouse, 5th floor proffer room area
keyFacts: In April 2021, Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to review evidence with her defense team at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse over multiple days.
The FBI was requested to provide agents to assist with security, specifically to monitor Maxwell, who was in custody and required escort even to the bathroom.
The US Marshals Service was responsible for producing Maxwell to the courthouse each morning.
Three proffer rooms at the courthouse were reserved: one for evidence, one for private defense meetings, and one as a break area for agents and prosecutors.
The email chain shows coordination between law enforcement (FBI Squad C-20, US Marshals) and prosecutors (AUSAs) for a high-profile defendant's pre-trial preparations.
